topic.title: It was just a matter of time until spammers took over zerotalk.
topic.body: What can be done about it? Could there possibly be a way of not seeding spam posts, or blacklisting files signed by specific keys?

topic.title: Using webfonts in ZeroNet sites
topic.body:
When I include webfonts hosted alongside a ZeroNet site, the browser shows an error saying, "'access-control-allow-origin' header is present on the requested resource". It seems that ZeroNet's webserver needs to send a CORS HTTP header when serving webfonts.

Am I missing something? Is there a way to configure it, or is this a bug in the software? 

As a workaround, I'm currently just using google fonts, but obviously that runs counter to the purpose of using a distributed network.

1_16bYoVV4ZHBY4kA416cTDvU1ZpjcLNkavi.body: Let's be serious, if you're on zeronet you're knowledgeable enough to set one up on a VPS as others have recommended. Packages like Algo and Streisand hold your hand through the entire process, and having a your own host avoids being blocked by VPN blacklists. Sans promotion, I think OVH has the cheapest machines out of the big providers, but it lacks support for automatically deploying machines with the aforementioned packages.

1_14F35JcfbZxUgkq9CA9NdzN1nKBdPpVoPJ.body:
> [parziva1](#comment_4_1Jk4sn5eCV5Eh2nojso2k8tmbSjLTdCgAx): What happened with spammers. (I just joined.)

Not much in reality, the title was sorta hyperbolic, but I noticed an uptick in nutters and scammers hawking their shitty websites here.
